result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven F Schmid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 10/01/2016; alternate 13 days. Payment plan fee to be added as well of $15.00
DNA costs to be paid along with fine on payment plan.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven F Schmid in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the amended charge. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine:  $442.00
DNA Surcharge $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to pay $50.00 amonth commencing 10/01/2016 or alternate of 13 days jail
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Steven F Schmid in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting the plea and sentencing be adjournment. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Steven F Schmid in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court withdraws the capias. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to pay restitution. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on August 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
